direction.raw_text: of the solitary figure of a WOMAN standing professionally alone at the end of the street. It is a bright, still night. We can HEAR the Woman whistling 'Stardust' merrily to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: around her. A Man's footsteps are overlaid. We HEAR the Man start to whistle 'Stardust' under his breath - haltingly at first, then in time with the Woman. As we approach, she glances at us over her shoulder - then turns round for a better look. Her whistling stops - so, at the same moment, does the man's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of DORA - a plump, attractive brunette - still young enough to need two glances at the customers. She smiles at us - and is pleased with the reception. She hesitates for a long moment, weighing us up carefully... and then - half defiantly, half expecting to be laughed at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evidently we have two quid. She beams with relief - throws her fur over her shoulders, jerks her head towards the right - and sets off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: after her.  Overlaid is the sound of the man's footsteps. Dora resumes her whistling. So, under his breath, does the man who is following her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wider street than the last - but just as empty. Dora sways her way towards a small house. CAMERA FOLLOWS at a respectful distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S from Dora's hips to an overflowing dustbin. CLOSE SHOT of a man's hand throwing something into the dustbin. It is an empty packet marked Kodak Film.  CAMERA PANS to Dora's house. It stands next to a chemist shop. Dora climbs the few steps which lead to her front door - glances round at us encouragingly - then unlocks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She switches on a light - and hurries up a flight of stairs. CAMERA TRACKS after her. She changes her tune to 'Goodnight Sweetheart'... and so - under his breath - does the Man who is following her. A woman with hair like a two-toned car comes down the stairs, winks at Dora - looks at us for a moment with great curiosity... winks... then passes out of camera. Dora reaches the landing - we are close behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dora unlocks the door of her room - and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She switches on the light, throws her fur onto a chair, lights the gas fire  then turns round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Dora. She holds out her hand-smiling. And suddenly. There is a gentle whirring purring sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dora - she is staring at something with great curiosity. It turns quickly to bewilderment - and the bewilderment to fear. She steps back from CAMERA - but CAMERA won't have it. Dora is now staring at something in horror - she opens her mouth to scream - a shadow falls across her face. The sound purrs on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FADE IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The solitary figure of Dora standing professionally alone at the end of a street. WE SEE her turn towards CAMERA - and smile at us. We are watching her on a 16mm screen - projected in BLACK AND WHITE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to show the surround in natural colour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A darkened room in natural COLOUR. The movie screen images are in BLACK AND WHITE. We can SEE the back of a Man's head as he bends intently over a projector. He is watching Dora on the screen. He is breathing quickly. We see Dora's hips waggling their way home. The Man raises his head, so that we cannot see the screen. When he lowers it again, we see the Woman with the two- toned hair winking at Dora... then we see Dora throwing her fur onto a chair - and turning towards us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: her staring at something in bewilderment... then backing away from CAMERA in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Man breathing as if at the end of a very long race. As Dora opens her mouth to scream, and a shadow falls across her face - the title:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blots out what is happening to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... behind them we can see Dora's hands pushing something away. Before the DIRECTOR'S CREDIT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is very dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a stack of deck chairs. Two forms behind it - a MAN'S and a WOMAN'S. They are intertwined and motionless... suddenly a brilliant shaft of light is trained onto them. Overlaid is a gentle, whirring sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S quickly to a nearby tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the lens of a cine-camera - the motor purring... a blinding spotlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to the couple - the whirring of the camera is overlaid. The Man leaps up - shielding his eyes against the light. He advances towards the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spotlight goes out. There is the sound of footsteps running away  and the night is at peace again. And now WE SEE who DIRECTED the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AMBULANCE - DAY It is standing in the roadway outside Dora's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it through the finder of a small cine-camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crowd has gathered outside the house - and we are watching them from a corner of the street (ALWAYS THROUGH THE FINDER- MATTE).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: several Policemen holding back the crowd as two Ambulance Men hurry into the house, carrying an empty stretcher. Gentle, whirring sound is overlaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: children staring curiously into the empty ambulance - and a group of Women talking excitedly to a Reporter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a SMALL MAN looking at us curiously as he approaches (FILLING THE SCREEN WITHIN THE MATTE).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The finder is lowered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a Young Man (MARK) sighting a cine-camera. He lowers the camera - and turns politely to his interrogator. He seems to have slight difficulty informing his words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark smiles at him pleasantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ambulance Men come out of the house carrying the stretcher... there is a body on it covered by a sheet. Mark raises his cine-camera and photographs them. He photographs the ambulance as it drives off. He photographs the Policemen dispersing the crowd. He photographs his Interrogator, who gladly poses for him. Then he slings his camera over his shoulder, and strolls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Dora, smiling happily. Her photograph is on the front page of a newspaper. Above it is a caption: BRUTALLY MURDERED. CAMERA PULLS BACK - to show sexy magazines alongside the newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark is staring at a newspaper in the window of a small newsagent's shop. He glances distastefully at an array of film magazines - showing actresses showing everything - then hurries into the shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A plump, bald-headed Man stares at Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns towards a small door at the end of the shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark turns round. Mr. Peters hesitates, drumming his fingers on the counter. CLOSE SHOT of Mark. He starts to drum his fingers on a shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops drumming his fingers. So, at that moment, does Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overlaid is the sound of the door opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark busies himself sorting some newspapers. A whole row of Doras smile up at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Mark... I've a question for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Which magazines sell the most copies?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those with girls on the front covers - and no front covers on the girls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Exactly!... And it's just the same with the work you do for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S to doorway of the shop. An ELDERLY GENTLEMAN is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Elderly Gentleman hesitates - glancing at Mark's back. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From under the counter he produces a thick book. Mark turns round. From his POV WE SEE the Elderly Gentleman open the book. He - er- seems - er - more than a little interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Elderly Gentleman hesitates.  Mr. Peters turns over a page... and the Elderly Gentleman almost turns over with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts it in a wrapper which says 'Educational Books'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds open the door for the Elderly Gentleman, and watches him leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns triumphantly to Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark pockets them without counting them. CLOSE SHOT of Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up a postcard - holds it towards Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark looks at the postcard in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pats Mark's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens a door at the far end of the room. We catch a glimpse of a winding staircase. He starts to climb it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... er... have been told by a friend that you... er... have some views for sale?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS What sort of views, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take this one... and, er... this one... and, er... how much would the lot be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS To you - five pounds, sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Tell you what, sir. Four pounds ten - and I'll throw in The Times and Telegraph... how's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, er... thank you very much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Let me wrap it for you, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Shall I put you on our mailing list?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no! But I'll look in again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS He won't be doing the crossword tonight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS (counting out money from wallet) Those pictures he chose... were all yours! (handing notes) This is yours!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS (in a very different tone) And this is yours too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS And that's what I want to talk to you about. It's a clever picture - because you're a clever lad... but, Mark... (pathetically) It's all face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS I don't want to hurt your feelings, son - but if people want the Mona Lisa they go to the National Gallery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS Well, wherever they go, they don't come here... so no more of this fancy stuff...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS ... now get upstairs - the girls are waiting... and so is a bonus if you give me what I want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS (amused) What do you do with all your money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At the top of the staircase is a door. Mark and his camera trudge towards it. The door opens suddenly. A vivacious young redhead - Milly - pokes her head round. She has a towel round her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From REVERSE ANGLE WE SEE Mark venture a shy smile at Milly. Milly opens the door impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the half-open door we catch a glimpse of a second Girl (LORRAINE). She is staring out of a window, her back to camera. She is naked except for a shawl draped round her shoulders. Mark enters the room... the door begins to close. CAMERA TRACKS towards the door. On the threshold of the room, a hood is thrown over our faces. THE SCREEN BLACKS OUT. In the darkness WE HEAR Milly's voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well look who's here! Cecil Beaton!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, sonny... make us famous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Did you read about that girl who was murdered last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are with Mark under the hood of an antiquated camera. Through the ground-glass of the camera WE SEE a SMALL INVERTED IMAGE of Milly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear Lorraine's voice - muffled, and very far away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SMALL INVERTED IMAGE of Milly peers anxiously into the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ground-glass camera begins travelling slowly down Milly's back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The same thing nearly happened to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Last night! I went out with my boyfriend... We're getting married next month... trouble was my fiance saw us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: can you fix it so the bruises don't show?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Milly. She is on a couch, lying on her stomach at a slightly oblique angle. All that WE CAN SEE are her face and naked shoulders. From Milly's POV WE SEE Mark under the hood of an antiquated camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark's voice is MUFFLED under the hood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then be quick about it, sonny! I'm freezing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of her naked toes. They start to wriggle. CLOSE SHOT of Mark's toes - in sandals, next to the tripod of the camera. They start to wriggle. CLOSE SHOT of Lorraine. We watch her in profile as she stares out of the window - clutching her shawl. She has outstandingly beautiful features. CLOSE SHOT of Mark. He is standing by the side of the camera, studying us thoughtfully. He is holding a remote- control switch panel in his hand. He clicks off several lights and then switches several others on... then he ducks back under the hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We join Mark under the hood. WE SEE a small INVERTED IMAGE of Milly on the ground-glass. Her shoulders are now white and glistening, her spine caressed by shadows. She is staring into the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He adjusts the focus. We can see more clearly the contempt on Milly's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Milly's POV WE SEE Mark come round to the front of the camera, and insert a dark slide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark presses a rubber bulb - the shutter clicks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark inserts another dark slide.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There he goes again! What have you got under there? A girlfriend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose you have a girlfriend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Milly. MILLY Hear that, Lorraine? He's available.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Raise your head, please - and look at the sea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just wanted that puzzled look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh, did you? Well if you want it again, I'll think of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: from Milly's viewpoint, WE SEE Mark holding the rubber bulb. cine-camera is on a ledge behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark presses the rubber bulb - the shutters click. MILLY This is a spare time job for you, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He inserts another slide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He presses the bulb - the shutters click.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He inserts another slide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He presses the bulb - the shutters click.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark looks at her thoughtfully for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark smiles at her shyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark inserts another slide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a gentle KNOCK at the door, and Mr. Peters enters. He carries a tray of coffee. He keeps his eyes modestly lowered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lays the tray on a table, still keeping his eyes lowered, and goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're a puzzle and a half.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what do you do for a living?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well what sort do you like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I may show you - one day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That'll be a treat, I'm sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, sonny! Now take one I can show my mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some house! Hope it falls on his ruddy earhole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Lorraine staring out of the window. She stiffens. Milly's voice is overlaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorraine clutches her shawl tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorraine turns round. The left side of her face is classical in its beauty. She has a hare lip, which twists and distorts the whole of the right side. Her eyes are large - and beautiful - and defiant.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (in a whisper) ... it's her first time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, love. Don't be shy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Lorraine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He said... you needn't photograph my face!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Lorraine. Beautiful in profile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose you'll fix my bruises too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of the shawl round Lorraine's shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Mark.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You needn't be shy... of me... it's my first time too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Lorraine's eyes - puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to go on - but words are a foreign language to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a sudden rush:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lorraine - let my camera tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Lorraine standing very still  looking at him in silence. Milly shrugs and reaches for the coffee pot. Overlaid is the gentle purring of a cine-camera.

direction.raw_text: . HELEN'S SITTING ROOM - EVENING - TOWARDS SUNSET The hand filling the glass is a woman's (MRS. STEPHENS). She is sitting in a high-backed chair, and we cannot see her face. Over her shoulder we watch a party in progress. A group of Young people have surrounded someone to whom they are singing:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Happy birthday to you, Happy birthday to you,
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of TONY HUNTER, a well-built youngster in his middle twenties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He obviously means it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of 'dear HELEN'. A sensitive, intelligent, and extremely attractive girl, who  as the encircling youngsters now inform us in song - is:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty-one today, She's twenty-one today, She's got the key of the door, She's never been twenty-one before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of the glass by Mrs. Stephens' side. It is half empty. An elderly lady leans across to her. She is Mrs. Partridge, slightly high on a glass of sherry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Stephens grunts. Someone switches on a gramophone and the young couples start dancing at once. Tony hurries up to Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen goes towards him. A YOUNG MAN calls out sharply:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is pointing at something out of camera. All heads - except Mrs. Stephens' - follow the direction of his gaze. Mrs. Stephens continues to sit motionless in the high-backed chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . PARTRIDGE You must be very proud of your daughter, Mrs. Stephens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S to the window. Mark is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen looking at Mark. We watch him over her shoulder - Tony's arm encircling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EVENING - LOW SUN The chap from upstairs presses his face to the window. From his POV WE SEE Helen's eyes looking at him - the key of the door in them - looking at him, not staring. Suddenly the rest comes into focus - Tony's arm around Helen's shoulder... the high-backed chair in the foreground with the back of that motionless head... a young couple giggling as they stare at him. Mark steps away, and the CAMERA PULLS BACK with him. We catch a glimpse of the house - large, sprawling, but with a touch of quality about it, in a quiet, unpretentious street. Mark hurries towards a side entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen looking at the empty window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Tony - frowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to Mrs. Stephens' glass... the hand which refills it has begun to tremble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights are on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark (and his camera) along a small passage which leads to the hall. The sound of a dance record can be heard. Mark starts to whistle it under his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over his shoulder we see a staircase, and beyond it the door of Helen's sitting room. The sound of Helen's party fills the hall. Mark reaches the staircase. There is the sound of a door opening. Helen's voice is overlaid:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark hesitates, then turns round. CLOSE SHOT of Helen - smiling at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark looks at her as if he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her directness is natural, consistent and very hard to resist.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know how many times we've passed each other on the stairs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... but tonight I'm determined at least to say hello to you! So hello!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark - smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances with unconcealed interest at the camera over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds out her hand... he takes it gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances again at his camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She realizes that this is not the happiest of phrases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hesitates. CAMERA PANS to Helen's door. Tony stands there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm having a party - and the other tenants are there...  And a few friends. We'd like you to join us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please come in... you'll meet the others who live here, and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I hope to keep it going for hours yet... so when you've finished why not look in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark - looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurries up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen. She stares after him for a moment. Then returns thoughtfully to her party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The screen remains dark for a moment. We are with Mark in a darkened room. He is giving a film show - and we are the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His cine-projector points straight at us.  A flickering light shines in our eyes. We can see him crouching behind the projector. Mark leans forward, watching the screen intently... Perspiration trickles down his forehead. He is breathing very quickly. The sounds of the party seep up from downstairs - music, laughter, and a Girl's yelp. There is a knock on the door. Mark does not hear it. CAMERA PANS to the door of the room. It is blacked-out like a photographic dark-room. The knock is repeated. CLOSE SHOT of Mark. He switches off the projector instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to an open cupboard in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the shelves. They are stacked with spools of film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: travels slowly over these spools. WE SEE Mark's hand add two more to the collection; his Voice is overlaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He closes the cupboard door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark comes out of the dark-room behind him - the light is kept out by a baffle and a curtain. He has a pleasant, normally untidy bedsitting room. He wipes his handkerchief across his forehead - then hurries to the door. He opens it - Helen is standing there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hope I'm not disturbing you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark - shaking his head, smiling shyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen.

direction.raw_text: She turns round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We can HEAR - faintly  the dance music from downstairs. There is a click - and the walls are suddenly bathed in diffused light, throwing the room into delicate shadow. CLOSE SHOT of Helen looking round in amazement. As certain events of possible interest are to take place in this room, here, in detail, is what amazes Helen. The room is the product of three rooms which have been knocked into one. It is very large and extremely well constructed (as we are soon to learn, it was originally a laboratory). One half of the room is used for processing, and the other half for filming - and for trade shows. The two halves are lined by long shelves upon which are perched all shapes and sizes of cameras, their spectacles glinting in the light. In the processing half two benches (a 'dry' bench and a 'wet' bench) face each other against opposite walls. There are three sinks above the 'wet' bench and an outburst of equipment above the 'dry'. This part of the room is lit by two dark-room lamps frowning in the ceiling above the benches. The other part of the room has a window at the far end of it. Heavy drapes are putted across it. Mark's projector rests on a small table in front of the 16mm screen.  Two banks of floods and a variety of spots light this part of the room. There is a small control panel on the wall. Some of the equipment is ancient - but none of it is old. All of it glistens with the affection of its owner. There is absolutely nothing in the room to alarm anyone except an adult... the kind who starts to wonder who paid for it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bends and looks into the finder. There is a single harsh chord of music - and the screen goes dark. It remains dark for a moment. Suddenly the darkness parts like curtains - and in the centre WE SEE Vivian's face in the finder of the studio camera. (Unlike the ground-glass of the newsagent's camera, we see everything the right way up and in perfect perspective.) Mark hooks a filler-light below the camera and switches it on. He adjusts the finder until he has made of Vivian's delicate features a radiant miniature. The miniature smiles shyly at him. She has stopped dancing and is looking directly at the camera. Music continues.

direction.raw_text: . - EARLY EVENING CLOSE SHOT of Mark. He is holding his cine-camera; fixed to it is a collapsible tripod. Suddenly he pulls one leg of the tripod out. WE SEE that a very sharp spike protrudes from the end of it. From Mark's POV WE SEE Vivian looking at the spike. He raises it towards her - until the spike is only inches from her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can hear his heart pounding as if it will burst - and gradually Vivian, too, becomes aware of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just for a moment Mark's arm moves. His back hides what he is doing. Suddenly WE SEE Vivian turn her head sharply - she is looking at something out of camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spike is very close to her throat - but Vivian ignores it, staring out of camera. Over Mark's shoulder we concentrate on Vivian's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fear on her face is rapidly growing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to move back - but the trunk prevents her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is almost a scream. We can hear Mark breathing quickly. Vivian raises her hands to push something away from her. Suddenly the screen is filled with her eyes. WE SEE them dilating with terror. There is a sudden crash as the big power switches go out in the roof. The lights go out. There is a scream in the darkness. Then silence. The darkness acquires a grey, opaque quality as if one is seeing the world through a curtain - it is the world of Mrs. Stephens. A bright light is felt, rather than seen, beating against our eyelids. It looms closer and stronger.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) And that, darling, is the end of the news! Unless you want the football results?

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Facing Mark is the darkened set of an hotel bedroom. Beyond this is another set - also in darkness - and beyond this yet another. Only in the far comer of the studio - in the furthermost set - is there a light burning. Voices can faintly be heard coming from this set. Mark walks quietly towards a long ladder which leads up to the gantry. Carefully - rung by rung - he starts to climb the ladder. At the top of the ladder is a gallery. Mark moves along the maze of bridges until he is nearly above the Policemen. Mark raises his head cautiously - and looks down. Far below WE CAN SEE the Inspector standing next to the Doctor - a tall, silver haired man - who is peering into an open trunk. Detectives are photographing the set. Mark raises his cine-camera... its gentle purring seems to echo round the studio.

She leans forward - her face only inches from the screen - the light from the projector flickering on to her. REVERSE ANGLE SHOT of Mrs. Stephens. Slowly she stretches out her hands and touches the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her head and shoulders blot out most of the screen - but between her outspread fingers WE CATCH A GLIMPSE of a girl's terrified eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Cloth... with something hard inside it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a changing bag... we put films in it - so that the light won't spoil them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS How odd - that the light can spoil anything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Every night you switch on that film machine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS What are these films you can't wait to look at?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS (O.S.) What is the film you're showing now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Why don't you lie to me? I'd never know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Take me to your cinema.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS What am I seeing, Mark?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark and Mrs. Stephens.

direction.raw_text: He hurries to his cine-camera.

direction.raw_text: He looks at her thoughtfully, then presses a light switch. A spotlight falls blindingly on to her eyes. He presses another switch, and then another, until the whole of her face is shining with light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks towards her. She starts to back away. The shadow of Mark's head appears on the 16mm screen. WE SEE him raise his camera - then pull down the tripod. Black out into the grey darkness of Mrs. Stephens' world. WE HEAR the purring of Mark's camera - more clearly than we have yet heard it. (There is the faint rasp of a cog which needs oiling.) The sound of footsteps approaching... the purring changes direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The purring is on top of her. There is a sudden thud.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at the screen) It's no good - I was afraid it wouldn't be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS I've yet to meet an artist who could judge his own work...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS What do you think you've spoiled?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An opportunity... now I must find another.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Why are you putting those lights on my face?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Mrs. Stephens is leaning against the wall... she has dropped her heavy stick. It lies on the floor a few feet away from her. Mark is kneeling in front of her - the tripod firmly on the floor. The cine-camera is pointing upwards into her face. He peers excitedly into the viewfinder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She edges towards her stick. He hurries forward and picks it up. He looks at the spike on the end of it - then carefully gives it to her by the handle. She grasps it tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He returns excitedly to his camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Mark's focusing screen WE SEE the fear on her face. Her hand trembles as she wipes away the perspiration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it is fear that we are looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the focusing screen we see her moisten her lips nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He switches off the camera abruptly, and folds up the tripod. He turns away without looking at her - and hurries to the door.

dialogue.raw_text: Please let me finish! It's for Helen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS What do you mean? It's for Helen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She wants to see something I've photographed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS My daughter sees enough of my face without photographs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS So put that camera away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mrs. Stephens listening to his movements - puzzled.

direction.raw_text: He glances towards her. From his POV WE SEE the fear in her eyes. He looks away at once, staring into the darkened room.

direction.raw_text: He glances towards her - then hurries into the next room.

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS In rather a hurry, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS You're anxious to get rid of me all of a sudden.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS I won't be selfish... You can take some more pictures - if you want to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Can't you find some - to please Helen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS You don't trust yourself to take any more, do you?

direction.raw_text: He turns towards her - a small boy who suddenly understands what contagious means...

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS Instinct's a wonderful thing, isn't it Mark? A pity it can't be photographed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS if I'd listened to it years ago, I might have kept my sight. (she approaches the door) I wouldn't have let a man operate I had no faith in... so I'm listening to it now... (she puts her face close to him) It says all this filming isn't healthy - and that you need help...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS ... get it, Mark... get it quickly... and until you've got it... I don't want you and Helen to see each...

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS I'd rather you don't have the chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . STEPHENS I mean it, Mark. And if you don't listen to me... one of us will move from this house - which would be a pity, because we'd never find a cheaper...

direction.raw_text: . MORNING From his POV WE SEE Mark hurrying along the studio quadrangle, his camera over his shoulder. He is one of a crowd of people scurrying towards their jobs. Camera pulls back - Don Jarvis is seated at his desk. Arthur Baden and the Chief Publicity Man are seated in front of him. The Sergeant stands by the door.

dialogue.raw_text: Have you any suspicions, Chief Inspector?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could be any of them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the trouble with film people - they're all peculiar... (hastily) ... present company excepted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've a psychiatrist coming down today. Dr Rosen -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's pure publicity - and I promise he won't do any work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get himself photographed... We're telling the press he's here to help the case - and to see if he can spot the murderer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be frank. I'd welcome anyone's help... I don't know how this maniac kills - or why he kills - or who he'll kill next, but if he isn't caught quickly... (he shrugs')
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Inspector, have you convinced yourself he's a member of my unit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir ... but a few things seem to point to it... No one outside your unit admits to knowing the girl... There was a trunk all ready for her... and with the risks he was running, I think he'd have to use surroundings he was familiar with... Where is your unit now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Waiting for me on the set.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to watch them at their jobs, sir. It may tell me more than a hundred interviews.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, Inspector, the strain on them is already...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come now, Arthur, if that's what the Inspector wants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid it is, sir... now where could I get the best view?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sulkily) On the dolly... the camera... You can watch everyone and everything from there... including me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well, sir ... I'll become a member of your camera crew...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Don Jarvis) ... if the unions don't object!

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hear they're making an arrest today.

dialogue.raw_text: 2 hope it's D.J. It's about time they caught up with him!

direction.raw_text: . - DAY The (studio) camera is ready for a tracking shot. The set is redressed as the Hat Department of the store. The Inspector stands on the dolly, looking round with interest. The Doctor is sitting in a chair watching everything like an excited schoolboy. The Sergeant has positioned himself near the sound crew. Baden walks on to the set, his arm round Diane's shoulder. He is talking to her softly. She keeps her eyes on the floor; he leads her to the front of the studio camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pats her arm reassuringly. The Chief Cameraman nods to Mark. From the Inspector's POV WE SEE Mark pull a tape measure from the front of the camera and hold it to Diane's forehead. From Mark's POV WE SEE the Inspector watching him over the top of the studio camera. A man with a shock of white hair is also watching him... and the Sergeant stares at him from the other side of the set. The tape measure in Mark's hand remains steady. From the Inspector's POV WE SEE Mark replace the tape measure and take up his position on a small stool by the side of the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Doctor sneezes violently - and all heads turn towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the nervous laughter that follows, the Assistant Cameraman whispers to the Chief Cameraman.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Try it, darling... We'll all be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That sneezer geezer's a psychiatrist!... Heard it on the grapevine.

dialogue.raw_text: ... in... red (suddenly she covers her face in her hands') I can't! I can't, Arthur!

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Professor... but of course I knew him. He lectured to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was an extraordinary man - quite brilliant!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what he was interested in before he died?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't remember what he called it... It was something to do with what causes people to be... peeping Toms...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scoptophilia!... That would interest him! A most fertile mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: philia... The morbid urge to gaze... Coined since his day... Have you any manuscripts of his which I could...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He thought... it could be cured...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The cure? Very quick... A couple of years analysis - three times a week - an hour a time - and it's soon up-rooted...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... if you've any of his papers on the subject?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll find out afterwards... Now, listen... I want you to watch who brings their own lunches... Someone ate homemade cakes and sandwiches by the side of those bushes - and we may get a lead.

dialogue.raw_text: think so... we had a little chat about scoptophilia - and he's going to show me...

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON Mark hurries towards the shop... ahead of him a street clock stands at just on six. Mark unslings his cine-camera and photographs this clock... then he hurries into the shop. The man in the raincoat walks into camera. He looks at the clock, puzzled, then glances at the newsagent's window. He gazes with interest at Mark's photograph of Milly, then walks thoughtfully down the street. All the clocks in the kingdom chime the hour of six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Peters is behind the counter.

direction.raw_text: He turns to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

CAMERA TRACKS TOWARDS the door of the shop. Mark comes out, his cine-camera over his shoulder. He has a key in his hand. He closes the door of the shop... then looks at the key. He fits it into the lock - then slips it through the letter-box. He turns and hails a taxi.

direction.raw_text: . STEPHENS' BEDROOM - EARLY EVENING She is lying in bed - completely drunk - snoring lustily. A hand smooths her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is leaning over the bed. She has her coat on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her mother's shoulders. Mrs. Stephens snores on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her again  but it is hopeless. Helen pulls the bedclothes round her mother, then turns away. She picks up a large envelope and her handbag, and hurries to the door.

direction.raw_text: . MARK'S HOUSE - EARLY EVENING Helen walks towards the stairs. The door of Tony's room opens, and he pokes his head round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes into his room, closing the door. She stares after him for a moment, then hurries up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't much time for me these days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right - I'll be here - if you want me. (he turns to his room) ... by the way... your mother was yelling out something before you came in... about Mark photographing her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Photographing Mother? You must be mistaken!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Helen knocks on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. She knocks again, then opens the door and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen enters and glances towards the door of the dark-room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mark?  No answer. She looks thoughtfully at the envelope in her hand - then goes in to the dark-room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Helen fumbles for a switch... she finds one and presses it. A spotlight falls on Mark's projector, throwing its shadow on to the dazzling white screen. Helen smiles, and walks towards the projector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taxi arrives and Mark gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... don't know what to make of it, sir ... He went to a library, a solicitor's office, and a newsagent's shop - private photography there, if you ask me. Shall I hang around outside the house, sir? Don't think so, either... All right, sir, I'll give you the details when I get back... Bye, sir. (he replaces the receiver)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen. She is standing by the projector, holding her envelope thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles suddenly and opens her envelope. She takes out a bound manuscript. We see a label on the manuscript: The Magic Camera by Helen Stephens. She takes a pencil from her pocket, and opens the manuscript. Then she sits at Mark's table and writes a note on the flyleaf. The projector is at her elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A telephone by a man's elbow. It rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chief Inspector snatches up the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Mr. Peters - looking very sick - on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Chief Inspector Gregg! What?  Put him on the line...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PETERS went up to look around - found her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of the Chief Inspector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slams down the receiver, and jumps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, yes... What's the address? ... Newsagent's shop? ... Did you say news...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An empty taxi cruising down the street. It passes the Detective in the raincoat walking away from Mark's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a note on a flyleaf which reads 'From one Magic Camera - which needs the help of Another'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen closes the manuscript and lays it carefully by the side of the projector. She turns to leave - then looks curiously at the projector. CLOSE SHOT of Helen - hesitating. Like a small girl in front of her mother's make-up box, she touches the projector tentatively, hesitates again, then presses a switch. A beam of light shoots out. We watch Helen's face as she looks at the screen. Nothing seems wrong for a few seconds - then something starts to happen to the comers of her mouth... and then her eyes become locked... and cannot stop watching. Some kind of sound comes from the back of her throat. Her hands dig into the table and she tries to stand up. She cannot manage it the first time - and keeps on watching, then, like a child waking from a nightmare, she jerks herself away from the table, and stumbles towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Mark standing there - watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen staring at him... again we hear that sound from the back of her throat. He looks away from her at once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands with her back to him. From REVERSE ANGLE we see her struggling for breath. Over her shoulder WE SEE him staring at the 16mm screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over her shoulder we see him hurry towards the projector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of him switching it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wheels round towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From REVERSE ANGLE we see her looking at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let me see you... frightened... (he pushes the door wide open...) Leave! (he looks at her - then looks quickly away) Hurry, Helen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not... (she turns away from him and forces the words out) ... till I know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... horrible ... horrible... but... just a film... isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No... (he walks towards the door) I killed them... (he locks the door with a hint of sadness) And now that you know... I want you with me... a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Helen  not enough breath to scream... hardly enough to breathe. MARK You'll be safe - as long as I can't see you frightened - so stand in the shadows, Helen... please... She stands motionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From her POV WE SEE him standing in front of the door, looking ahead of him. She backs slowly away into the shadows at the back of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She's right... your mother... must tell someone everything... sorry... has to be you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Helen standing in the shadows where her mother stood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is suddenly filled with the terrified screaming of a small boy. Helen wheels round. The screaming seems to be coming from the walls. Mark's hand is on a switch - one of a number on a panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He presses another switch. There is a click, and the screaming stops, to be replaced by a low sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He presses another switch. There is a moment's silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This was his laboratory... and you know some of what he did... but not all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All the rooms were wired for sound... and... still are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the ticking of a clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Helen - listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The click of a switch - and we hear a loud snoring. MARK Tony's. The click of a switch - and we hear Tony's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark listens with interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does so - at once. She walks towards him. He turns away from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly he faces her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to turn away - but she follows him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) No one will come in... honestly, darling...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do... to those girls?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you want to torment me... for the rest of my life... then make me imagine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark - his eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to his cine-camera, and picks it up. He releases the tripod.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do ... to those girls?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Show me - or I'll remain frightened... for the rest of my life.  Show me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Helen. She stands very still against the wall. Mark's voice is overlaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is looking at something, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of his footsteps approaching...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Do you know... what the most frightening thing in the world is?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So I did something... very simple...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a look of fear spring into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the spike approaching her throat... but she is looking at something else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spike is touching her throat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When they felt the spike... touching their throats... and knew I was going to kill them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... I made them - watch their own deaths!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Helen's face several times its natural size. She is looking at herself in a large circular magnifying mirror which has been fitted over the camera's face. The mirror entirely obscures both Mark and the camera. There is a small hole in the mirror through which the lens of the camera winks. As Helen looks at her terrified distorted face this small hole gives her an extra eye in the middle of her forehead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Made them see their own terror as the spike went in... and if death has a face, they saw that too!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark - crouching behind the mirror, sweat pouring down his forehead... his finger on the trigger of the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: throat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not you! Not you! I'll never photograph you! I promised - I promised - Not you! Helen's eyes are closed. The spike is still touching her
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Mark  his face turned away from the viewfinder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's the sound of a car pulling up. He hurries to the other room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Police arrive: three cars.  Mark appears at an upstairs window with his camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thinks Mark has a gun. They all duck. Mark raises his camera and photographs them. The Police recover and charge for the house. Mark disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark hurries back into the room carrying his camera. He knows exactly what he has to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rapidly he fixes his camera on to a hook on the wall. Then he adjusts the tripod so that the spikes protrude towards him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He makes chalk marks on the floor in front of the camera, then switches on all the floodlights. WE CAN HEAR the Policemen pounding on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses to a switch - presses it.  The room is filled with a small boy's screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands next to her, and looks at his long array of cameras. WE SEE that each one of them has been fitted with a small metal disc (a delayed release), and that some of the older cameras have flashlights attached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly he walks past his cameras. As he does, the metallic disc on each one explodes with a little plop - and the eye of each camera winks once as if in salute. Some go off with flashlights on either side of the room. The sound of footsteps hurrying up the stairs. Ahead of Mark - coming steadily closer  are the spikes of the tripod. The mirror on the cine-camera reflects the approach - and Helen's terrified face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The child's screaming reaches its peak as Mark approaches the spikes... Ahead of him, on the small table where his projector stands, is Helen's book The Magic Camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Policemen are now rattling on the dark-room door. MARK Helen - I'm afraid! We see his face, terrified, in the magnifying mirror. The spikes are against his throat. The eye of the camera is winking rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heavy shoulders are pressing against the dark-room door... as it breaks in, Mark lunges forward against the spikes. The cine-camera is wrenched away from the wall as he falls back. He crashes against the small table, which falls over. He is not parted from his camera - it is fixed to him by the tripod, and falls back with him, covering his face like a canopy. WE SEE his face in the lens of the cine- camera. and WE SEE his hand - lying limp on the cover of The Magic Camera. The Policemen hurry into the room. They stare motionless at what they see.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've been ready for this... for such a long time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch them, Helen... Watch them say goodbye - one by one - (he presses a master switch on the wait) I've timed this... so often...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish... I could have found your faces for you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Helen - her face buried in her hands. The child's screaming stops suddenly... and in the absolute silence which follows WE HEAR the voice of Mark's father:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a small voice answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spotlights begin to dim... The dazzling white of the 16mm screen fades slowly into greyness... The room is filled with the gentle breathing of a small child.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't be a silly boy... there's nothing to be afraid of...
dialogue.name: dialogue
